website_summaries.verdict: It's not the cheapest mill, but it is ideal for customers seeking a reliable and well-rounded product for consistent use.
pros: Stainless steel bowl prevents staining and easily holds hot foods
3 stainless steel grinding discs prepare foods with fine, medium, and coarse textures
cons: The pot is a bit small, holding no more than 4 cups at a time

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY unless you want metal in your food.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS!!! I bought this to make BABY FOOD and it is putting METAL GRIME into the food!! I was putting white sweet potato through this food mill and all of a sudden started to see grey flecks and I looked under the bottom and it was all coming from the center piece. Absolutely disgusting and DANGEROUS for an infant. I am horrified that I have already given my baby food that I put through this mill. You should be ashamed to be selling this.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie B

customer_reviews.title: Good but issues
customer_reviews.text: This is very good quality, but as a cook I have a couple of issues. I use it for tomatoes. The first issue is that the blade doesn't press against the disc closely enough to get all the pulp. Second, the fold-out legs are not long enough to sit over a large pot.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Lisi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for straining tomatoes!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to make fresh tomatoe sauce. It worked better than I expected and im definitely happy with the results!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to make tomato sauce and jams. I returned it. It came with the handle busted and for the price that should not have happened. I tried running a tomato through it and it barely created any sauce and just slung around the peel. Not effective and not worth the price. I usually love oxo products... not this one
customer_reviews.author: smarti620

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.text: Great way to speed up processing season-end tomatoes. Worked like a charm - smallest holes avoid seeds in the sauce. It sometimes takes a little poking to get the food running through the mill, but it was not hard work (with tomatoes).
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Requires A Lot of Work To Rice Potatoes
customer_reviews.text: Was really hoping this would be great based on the amount of purchases. Once you have used a professional Food Mill, this one is lackluster at best. It was easy to assemble (push the spring down and connect the tabs) and turns freely. The problem is that when ricing potatoes, the potatoes break up and get stuck to the sides. I spent more time pushing potatoes down with a spoon than I did ricing. It however does rice incredibly and I was able to make the smoothest, silkiest potatoes ever. Easy to clean up. Maybe the next version will take into consideration the gap between the blade and the sides and this will become a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Tom-So

customer_reviews.title: I love this food mill
customer_reviews.text: I love this food mill. I make blackberry jam every summer with our homegrown blackberries. This food mill allows me to mash the berries and eliminate almost all of the seeds. Yes, there are few that make it through the grinding disk holes, but most don't. This is easy to use and very durable. It is also beneficial in making my own tomato sauce. I usually can my tomatoes each year and then I use a few quart jars of tomatoes to make my spaghetti sauce. There are 3 different sizes of grinding disks. The disks pop out for easy clean up. The feet fold in for easy storage. This product is sturdy and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dryman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. I bought this for breaking down tomatoes and making baby food and it failed at both. It just pushes the food around the bowl. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cardiello

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy.  Cheap and shreds metal dust from blade grinding.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box I could hear the faint sound of the metal rotator scraping against the blade when the handle was rotated. I double checked to make sure we had it assembled as instructed and even changed out blades. We put it on a silicon mat and cranked the handle for about 30 seconds to test and guess what? Metal residue was on the mat. Had we not done this the metal shavings would have went unnoticed into our tomatoes.
customer_reviews.author: DocJJA03

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: When this arrived, I was a little skeptic. It seemed a little flimsy, but I was accustomed to my old, heavy-weight mill. So, it came as a pleasant surprise how well it worked. The discs are quick to change, and make for an easy clean-up. So far, I've only used it for tomatoes, so I can't comment on how well it will work on 'denser' food items. The only disappointment I have is that it has no pulp scraper.
customer_reviews.author: Michele F.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work very well
customer_reviews.text: I don't have much experience with food mills, but I do have a number of complaints about this one. The first is the pitch of the of the screw used to force food through the grates. It's too shallow and as such it tends to just push things around instead of down. Another issue I've had with this is it tends to just push things up onto the walls of the mill. One other complaint is that the tripod setup tends to make it unstable when milling, I believe four legs would be more appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: K Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Pass!!!
customer_reviews.text: This food mill blade hooks under the top rim and doesn’t totally meet up with the grating plate. Therefore, the food is difficult to pass through. And it takes way longer to use, even for applesauce! I am throwing it away and buying a good old-fashioned one that screws the blade to the grate and quickly passes the food through!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon1234

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and a quality product!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to use and clean. Took me a second to get it to work because of having the inserts upside down...but once I discovered that it was, it was smooth sailing. Caught all of the seeds, skin, and stems!
customer_reviews.author: A. Patel

customer_reviews.title: Don't make homemade sauce without it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing saved me this summer. I just started canning and began my making a batch of tomato sauce by hand. What a nightmare. It took me hours to try to press all the strewed tomatoes through a sieve and my arms ached. I thought there has to be a better way. And there is. The food mill! I was about to swear off canning, but then I tried this food mill and it made it so so so much easier. And the sauce was perfect. All the seeds and skins were easily removed with very little effort. I don't know why they don't sell these at every store they sell other canning equipment at, but they don't.
customer_reviews.author: Smile

customer_reviews.title: Terrible mill
customer_reviews.text: Used it few times since purchased . A complete disaster. I bought it mainly for tomato sauce, yet despite blanching the tomato , it did terrible job. I beleive there are better options with better prices. I gave it one star for fast delivery and easiness to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Ghalia

customer_reviews.title: Does Food Mill Stuff
customer_reviews.text: This mill has made a huge difference in the quality of the jams and fruit butters I make. While the occasional seed or piece of peel still slips through, it's a world of difference from the massive number that used to be in them. It doesn't do well with celery, but that's easily solved by peeling the veins first. The legs grip well and let it rest on larger containers readily. We have some 4 or 6 liter plastic buckets we use for proofing bread that it fits over perfectly. It seems durable but only time will truly tell on that. It's far easier to clean than I expected, even easier than the blender I used to use on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works well but needs 1 finer sieve
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove seeds from blackberries and currants. It works great. It’s pretty simple to clean too. I wish there was a finer sieve because with currants or raspberries you will still get some seeds to come through but would be great for anything with larger seeds like blackberries and tomatoes.
customer_reviews.author: MattReader

customer_reviews.title: Makes excellent apple and pear sauce!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this food mill exclusively for canning applesauce and pear sauce. It does a fantastic job of both. If you fill it to the top it doesn't work as well and you have to work harder than if you fill it 1/2 way, then it goes faster. It accumulates the pulp and you have to keep cleaning this out to use after 1-2 fills or it gets harder to puree. It is well made and evenly purees my apple and pear sauce making them 'silky' in texture and most delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M. Duffy

customer_reviews.title: So versatile!
customer_reviews.text: After using my mothers metal food mill for about 25 years I decided a new one would be in order. It comes with three milling discs so you can make different thicknesses of applesauce. I also use it to rice potatoes and it is much handier than a potato ricer. Makes great mashed potatoes. It’s sturdy, easy to clean and does a beautiful job.I’m sure you could use it for other things as well.
customer_reviews.author: amof2

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for making good pasta sauce but a little trcky to put together.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to make tomato sauce with San Marzano Tomatoes that later became really good Vodka Sauce. This food mill crushed up the San Marzano Tomatoes really well and removed all of the seeds very well. I will use this again and again to make both a simple tomato sauce with San Marzano Tomatoes and also the Vodka Sauce that I just mentioned. The only issue that I had was that it was a little tricky to put assemble. The assembly instructions were very simple and also very clear but the food mill itself just did not want to snap together easily.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca C

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I used this to make tomato soup and I'm about to make applesauce. The interchangeable plate size is nice. It's easy to clean and easy to use. The feet are nice and I did not have any slipping issues. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy to use, great final product
customer_reviews.text: Have used this mainly for making tomato sauce so far, and I love it. Love the velvety texture of the sauce. I was able to get as much liquid as I could have hoped from the tomatoes, and it was very easy to use--just remember to turn it backwards every so often to scrape the stuff off the bottom. It was fairly intuitive to put together, especially if you pay attention to 'this side up' on the disc, although the handle takes me a couple seconds to snap into place. Seems very high quality, and I love the fold-out feet!
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Albertsen

customer_reviews.title: Good size, works great.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for processing all of my tomatoes and apples for the season. I like that it is large enough to sit on top of a large pot and be steady. Easy to take apart and clean
customer_reviews.author: D. Ma

customer_reviews.title: Great features, but if you are used to commercial food mills it has room for improvement.
customer_reviews.text: I love the price, the fold out legs and the 3 different plates that come with the Oxo food mill, but I am used to using commercial mills and the blades on those push the food through much faster. I feel like I am spinning and spinning and spinning the handle and barely anything is coming through. It works eventually, but I feel like there is perhaps too much clearance between the blade and the plate where the food gets pushed through. That's really my only gripe.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Very handy for arthritic hands/wrists
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter who has arthritis. It works wonderfully without straining her hands and wrists when making mashed potatoes or any other thing she wants to run thru it She had originally asked for a ricer, but once I discussed how much more hand strength was needed for the ricer, she agreed to try this. She is very glad she got this instead, she says it is indispensable.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Velazquez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the best food mill I've ever had or used. Very sturdy, so easy to put together. A bit pricey, but it was well worth it. Looking forward to making seedless raspberry jam this summer!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does the Job
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says it will do, but the mechanisim for hooking the blade in is a bit challenging, even after using it multiple times. This is my first purchase of a food mill and I think I had higher expectations, but may this works normally. It does the job, but I feel like peeling and seeding the tomatoes myself is almost the same.... ALMOST. The pieces still have to be relatively small too be "caught" by the blade pushing the tomato downand if you are doing a lot of tomatoes, your arm WILL get tired and cramped!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Nicoll

customer_reviews.title: A KITCHEN WORKHORSE
customer_reviews.text: I'm never without a food mill, for creating creamy soups with marvelous texture, and for quickly preparing homemade tomato-based sauces with no annoying seeds or shards of skin. Oxo's design is superior, with a comfortable crank knob, and feet that adjust to bowls, saucepans, or stockpots of various sizes. Built to last, and to make you a kitchen wizard.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria LC

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: We had previously used an aluminum food mill with a wooden pestle to make spaghetti sauce, but the pestle was worn. The Oxo does a better job and is easier to clean. I feel it mashes the sauce finer (more finely?) than the old food mill. I was concerned about the stability, but the rubber legs worked fine. Very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Tompilot

customer_reviews.title: BE CAREFUL OF A DEFECTED SPRING.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed! If you like making sauces then you will enjoy this. UPDATE: Had to return it. After only 1 use, the spring appeared to be defected and was making a weird sound. It seemd it was snagging on to something. We tried to fix it but it we didnt want to make it worse so we decided to return it. We also didnt want metal shavings to fall into the puree.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rinaldi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent investment for foodies!
customer_reviews.text: Of course I love all oxtail products. Except for their cheese grater LOL this product creates the most perfect sauce from San Marzano tomatoes. Extremely easy to use, extremely easy to clean. I recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Dysartmanach

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I think this Food Mill is great. It's sturdy and easy to clean. I like the feet on the bottom, makes it very eat to use over a pot or a crock pot. Clean up was very easy. As with most kitchen gadgets that get goopy during use, wash it as soon as you're done with it - it will rinse right off.
customer_reviews.author: PLee

customer_reviews.title: Metal residue in the food
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered this food mill to make pureed baby food. I always use oxo products and never had a problem with them before but this one is an exception. To my surprise as I was grinding my baby’s home made apple sauce I saw a blackish grey residue in the middle of the bowl and as I inspected I saw that it comes from the middle part of the mill where the handle is attached with a black plastic. I am making my baby’s food at home to avoid any chemicals but now my baby’s food has metal residue in it!
customer_reviews.author: bmk

customer_reviews.title: Pasta sauce perfection!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfection for our tomato sauce! I must’ve saved an hour from my usual set up doing the tomatoes this way. Serious game changer. The holes are a bit challenging to clean, but all in all not too bad. Worth it for the amount of energy saved making sauces.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W. Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Good Food Mill for Everyday Use.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and performs wonderfully. Easy to use and easy to clean with great results. The whole thing can go in the dishwasher and comes out sparkling clean. The three interchangeable disks are a nice upgrade from the old mill with a fixed bottom. Easy to change and they stay in place solidly. This food mill is sized more for meal preparation than for large canning projects. A bit smaller than expected - must have been a very petite model they used in the video I watched!
customer_reviews.author: R. Jimerson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mashed potatoes
customer_reviews.text: Ok I am a envelope mashed potato girl so when I say this is easy it is. More effort than instant of course, but the taste is exceptional. Well worth the effort for that special dinner when you have to time to do just a little bit more. Better than using a mixer appliance, not starchy at all. yummy for sure
customer_reviews.author: France

customer_reviews.title: Best product to use when making mash potatoes for a group!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! 5lbs cooked potatoes into mashed in seconds! I microwave butter and milk for a minute while I process potatoes into the large serving bowl, add heated milk to the salted mash, DONE! It is on the table! Use this all the time, and gave one to each daughter for Christmas. Looking forward to making pasta sauces with fresh veggies from the garden next year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best way I have found to process berries.
customer_reviews.text: Used this product for making raspberry jam. It did not remove all of the seeds but it got rid of way more than other methods I have tried and was easy to use. It also allowed me to process more berries faster than other methods. I reccomend this to all home gardeners and cooks who need to remove seeds or skins.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Food Mill
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this for making fruit butters —I’ve probably made 10+ batches so far and it is exactly what i hoped it would be. Well built—easy to use, great results, and clean up is easy thanks to the dishwasher. I was tempted to get something cheaper, and I’m so happy that i didn’t—great product.
customer_reviews.author: Frank S.

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by how much i use it.
customer_reviews.text: Best kitchen item I've purchased for a while. I've used it for small batches of jams (blackberries, plum), tomato sauce (after roasting), and all sorts of soup. It may not be what you need to process gallons upon gallons of anything at a time. But it's been a very helpful easy-to-clean way to get rid of skins and seeds on a variety of fruit and veg.
customer_reviews.author: Freckles

customer_reviews.title: Great for Berry Jam!
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today, I processed blackberries through the mill for jam today. PERFECT! exactly what I was looking for. I think you will be happy with this product, it has feet that steady it over your bowl or pot and it's very simple and easy to use. Cleaned up quickly and easily with no fuss. It's exactly as they describe it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Really nice food mill. Makes things quite easy to create nice and smooth sauces.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorMasterBlaster

customer_reviews.title: I sure enjoy the shiny newness of my Good Grips" mill
customer_reviews.text: I learned to use a "Foley Mill" from my mother and grandmother. I have shared my mothers mill with my sister for years- but decided to buy my own. It does not have the "Sentimental value" of our old one- but man, I sure enjoy the shiny newness of my Good Grips" mill, and the versatility as well. I enjoyed mine so much that I bought these mills for my daughters . Theirs have now become much loved utensils in their own homes. Nothing like it for making applesauce and apple butter!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Most important thing I own in my kitchen. Would save it before the dogs if I had a fire!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t make my homemade sauce wi Hour my milk! Keep it clean and it will last forever. Side note— VERY IMPORTANT clean the disk off after you kill each large can of tomatoes it will allow you to mill 100 times faster as the seeds will block the juice from flowing once there are too many.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Stauber

customer_reviews.title: better than my old mill
customer_reviews.text: It broke my heart when my old mill cracked, but this one is made super well! It's easy to assemble and disassemble, a breeze to clean, and works beautifully. In one review, someone mentioned that it couldn't handle large loads of tomatoes. I nuke a HUGE bowl of Romas in the microwave for eight minutes, then spoon the mushy tomatoes into this bad boy and in just a few minutes, I'm done. The secret is in the turning: four turns clockwise, one turn counter-clockwise to clear the screen, repeat. You're left with only a tiny handful of skins and seeds, but watch out--they're HOT.
customer_reviews.author: Encie

customer_reviews.title: 2 quarts extra sauce for using food mill
customer_reviews.text: I got this for making apple sauce and it is amazing. I didn't realize how much apple sauce I was loosing to trying to do the straining with a normal sieve by hand, until I got an extra couple quarts from the last batch I made with a half bushel of apples. I wish I'd bought it sooner. There was very little waste left to put in the compost and I haven't noticed any apple skin pieces in the sauce. I haven't tried any other models of food mills before, but this one's nice and solid and stable.
customer_reviews.author: AGS

customer_reviews.title: Not as Good as I'd Hoped
customer_reviews.text: I liked the three support prongs. It is very awkward and difficult to install or change the discs, and I found that it didn't really do a great job milling tomatoes, which is what I bought it for. OXO products in general are very good, but I was disappointed in this one.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Great for making jams
customer_reviews.text: I use this for making jams and it has made the process So Much Easier. I make a lot of blackberry jam and getting most of the seeds out used to be a giant pain but this has made it quick and easy. Really sturdy product, easy to clean, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Holly2540

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Built well, but didn't work with cooked eggplant.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well-built, sturdy kitchen tool. Top quality. I've only used it one time, with cooked eggplant and it was an epic fail. Only a tiny amount made it through to the other side of the mesh - and I used the mesh with the largest openings. I'm sure it will work well with berries and other items.
customer_reviews.author: priusgirl13

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I used to it to make tomato and apple sauce. Works great to de-seed. Was stable on my pots and containers. Not quite logical to change the plates, but doable. I just had to fiddle with it for a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid design, super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought a food mill years earlier but it barely could turn. I thought this was a function of food mills in general, but it turns out, the first one I bought was just a lousy design. As per every OXO product I've owned, their food mill is incredibly thoughtfully designed. The pieces fit together easily, all the edges are pleasant rounded, and it feels built to last. I used the fine mesh to strain a fish stock and the thing worked like a charm. As a home cook, I couldn't ask for a better food mill.
customer_reviews.author: M. Yu

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This thing works. I was dreading processing 50lbs. Of tomatoes for paste. I purchased it and am very surprised at how fast and easy it was. Can’t wait to try other fruits and vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: jamieboy455

customer_reviews.title: terrible for mashed potatoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this food mill as a cheap option to pass mashed potatoes instead of using a more expensive mill. Problems: it doesn't push the potatoes well enough. the angle of the blade makes it necessary to use a spatula to keep "feeding" the mill. It also requires a small bowl due to the three "legs" so if you try to do any milling of any significance over a large bowl, good luck. For tiny jobs it's OK. For anything of significance, save money and get a bigger mill. You get what you pay for, I wish I could return this thing.
customer_reviews.author: knifetogo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy! Feet sits over the top of a bowl which is ad added plus! Want the best- this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Food mill
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my weekend jelly making project. I ended up processing smaller batches at the time so that I could extract the juices from the fruit. Cleanup was not an easy task either. It did make my project easier but was hoping to process largest batches to speed the process up.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to turn blade. Sent back
customer_reviews.text: Excited to get the item but quickly realized I had to return it. The blade was practically nonturnable!! Came assembled so I figured it wasn't me.
customer_reviews.author: Kaye Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Great for baby food!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little device! So far I've made butternut squash, sweet potato, peas, cantaloupe, blueberries and banana's for my little guy using this mill! I've also made "mashed" potatos that come out wonderfully! KidCo makes babyfood "ice trays" they are portioned out at about an ounce and a half (I'd guess). So you put your freshly milled food into the tray, freeze it and then you can pop everything out and put it into freezer storage bags! This works great, you only need to have one set of the KidCo trays and then just freeze and store the portions! I have a menagerie of homemade things for my son to eat! It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Kyseth

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled with my first food mill
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with how easy it is to make applesauce. I would have bought one of these years ago if I knew. I have also used it to make mashed potatoes. Our potatoes are from the previous season so the skins are a bit too thick and tough and they gum up the mill. But peeled or fresh potatoes go through easily as long as they are cooked long enough. I will post more later after trying other foods. I wish it came with more instructions, but it is not hard to find instructions for using food mills online. It is also very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W Stolsenberg

customer_reviews.title: Where was this all of my life???
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic little food mill! Where was this all my life? This made canning a breeze- easy to use, easy to clean and the rubber feet are life savers on a pot of hot tomatoes! I've used this to make ketchup, blood mary mix and spaghetti sauce. The fine grate doesn't let any seeds or particles through and the mill does it's job very well. Well worth the investment already and I've only been using it about a month! Wouldn't hesitate to purchase again. Will be using for applesauce later this fall.
customer_reviews.author: nic286

customer_reviews.title: No instructions
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it a 5 if it had actually came with instructions. Gets the job done. Could be a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Ross T.

customer_reviews.title: Never pressing through a sieve again!
customer_reviews.text: I am completely satisfied with this product. I purchased it specifically for pressing the liquids from fermented pepper mash for Louisiana style hot sauces . Without a lot of work I had the pulp and seeds left behind which I intend to dry and grind to powder for further fiery fun. I may find other good uses but my needs were met perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: AusTexRocker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Stayed on top of the bowl with no slipping. Gave it 4 stars on assembly because I have arthritis in my hands but my grandson had no problem.
customer_reviews.author: nancygail

customer_reviews.title: Better than the cone.
customer_reviews.text: Last time I made jam, I borrowed a friend's cone with a wooden pestle. It took what seemed like forever to squeeze out the juice and pulp. Using the food mill cut my effort to less than 1/2. It's sturdy, works well and cleans easily. I like the rubber feet that helps keep it in place as it hovers over the bowl. They then fold neatly underneath for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: This foodmill worked one time.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this food mill to make French fish soup. It worked great. I was so happy. Then a couple months later I tried to make the same soup and it failed. The blades locked up. I couldn't rotate the blade forward or backward. Today I thought I'd give it an easy test, grape jelly. It won't even mill cooked grapes. The blades lock up, even with a very small amount of product. I'm tossing it in the trash today.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Burt

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you won't be sorry
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been trying to improve her already awesome sauce. While watching a cooking show, she saw the chef use a food mill. The next day I ordered this one and by the weekend my wife was using it. I have to admit her spaghetti is a little better now. The cleanup is an absolute breeze if done right after use. So easy in fact, I have yet to put it in the dishwasher. Yep, I buy it again and I recommend you get one too!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Martin

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only used this to process tomatoes for canning. It has three discs of varying sizes to mill out seeds and skin. I can't imagine canning without it.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: The entire job was so easy. Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Make applesauce. The entire job was so easy. Would highly recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and Smooth!

product_meta.title: OXO Good Grips Food Mill
product_meta.description: The OXO Good Grips Food Mill is the perfect tool for preparing fresh purees, sauces, soups and more. It has a stainless steel inner bowl that is ideal for hot foods and will not stain, and includes 3 stainless steel grinding discs for fine, medium and coarse textures. Use the fine disc for homemade jellies, creamy sauces and baby food, the medium disc for applesauce and vegetable soups, and the coarse disc for mashed potatoes and chunkier sauces. The Food Mill has a unique release button that makes it easy to exchange discs and disassemble for storage. Three non-slip legs hold the Food Mill securely over bowls and pots up to 11 inches in diameter, keeping it out of your food. The legs also fold for easy storage. The soft, non-slip handle and knob ensure comfort when gripping the Food Mill and turning the blade. All parts are dishwasher-safe.
feature_bullets: Stainless steel bowl is ideal for hot foods and prevents staining
Includes 3 stainless steel grinding discs for preparing foods of fine, medium and coarse textures
Simple, spring-loaded lever for easy disc exchange and disassembly
3 non-slip legs secure placement over bowls and pots up to 11" in diameter, keeping Mill from falling into food
